title: Define System Requirements
description: Gather and document the functional and non-functional requirements for the distributed task scheduler, including scalability, fault tolerance, performance, security considerations, and integration with existing systems or third-party services.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the distributed task scheduler, including components, communication protocols, and data flow.

title: Implement Task Scheduling Logic
description: Develop the core logic for scheduling tasks across the cluster, including task distribution, load balancing, and fault tolerance mechanisms.

title: Develop Cluster Management System
description: Implement a system for managing and monitoring the cluster of machines, including node registration, health checks, and failover mechanisms.

title: Implement Task Submission and Monitoring
description: Develop a user interface or API for submitting tasks to the scheduler, monitoring task progress, and retrieving results.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Establish a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the distributed task scheduler.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the security of the distributed task scheduler by implementing authentication, authorization, and encryption mechanisms.

title: Develop Test Suite
description: Create a comprehensive test suite for the distributed task scheduler, including unit tests, integration tests, and performance tests.

title: Write Documentation
description: Prepare user and developer documentation for the distributed task scheduler, including installation guides, API references, and architectural overviews.
